lines.text: Lose a war and a man gets mean as a wounded bull.
And what do you do?
Can't you tell I'm a hooker?
You don't say! I guess men must really look you over.
That's what hookers are for.
What's your name?
Marie.
Mine's Lucie. But that's no name for a hooker, so I go by Lulu.
How much do you make a day?
Depends on the customer. I look, then I decide. Krauts pay through the nose. I can't help it.
Some of them are handsome.
True. But it's a matter of principle.
Is it true that some like to whip you?
No more than the French. Men have always treated us like horses.
I had a friend... She was taken away. A jew.
At least that can't happen to me. We're Normans. Nothing but hicks.

[laughs]
Me too.
I'm not just a housewife.
No offense, but you look like one.
Maybe, but I'm not what I seem to be. I even do things that are against the law.
Like what, baby face?
I've been a slave since I was 14. And I don't see how it'll ever change.
Like most women.
I don't care about "most women". I can't take it anymore!
No more empty bellies here. We're in the clover.
You handle a sword...
Forcefully?
Yes, that's it.
You're cute when you blush. All your freckles show. Are you ashamed?
Of what?
Of your freckles. Of turning me on.

[In bed]
Why are you smiling?
You're not the best ever, but I like your squirrel coat.
You could've said "fur".
"Fur" and "jewels" are words I never say in front of women.
You're not a romantic.
I'm a man.
Look after your sister, ducky. I've got to go.
We're occupied, you know! You may have fancy food and a lover, but there's still a war on.
I'm for the Resistance.
You idiot, you're not for anything!
And there's Pierrot. You too, ducky. Come dance with Mommy.
Do you think babies in their mother's belly have a soul?
I told the magistrate I wouldn't do it again. He said if I confessed, it'd go better for me.
[pause]
I want to become a singer.
It's easy to keep your hands clean when you're rich.

[sigh]
It's been four months now. They want to punish me? Let them do it. And it's all men. How could men understand, anyway?
If we ask for forgiveness, we may not go to hell.
Have pity on the children of the condemned.
You got angel eyes.
